senses.sense_definition: Действительное причастие прошедшего времени от глагола <w>навраться</w>.

examples.text: Вдоволь <w>навравшийся</w> рассказчик наконец замолчал, заметив недоверие в глазах слушателей.

target_lang_translations.en: The storyteller, <w>having lied to his heart's content</w>, finally fell silent, noticing the disbelief in the listeners' eyes.

examples.text: Этот человек, <w>навравшийся</w> с три короба, больше не вызывал у нас никакого уважения.

target_lang_translations.en: This man, <w>having told a heap of lies</w>, no longer commanded any respect from us.

target_lang_definitions.en: Having lied as much as one wanted; having told a lot of lies (past active participle of the verb meaning 'to lie to one's heart's content').

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: implies satisfying the urge to lie
emphasizes the quantity of lies told

en.target_lang_word: having lied to one's heart's content
en.target_lang_sense_clarification: idiomatic expression for doing something until satisfied
